Key Match Events: Argentina won the 2024 Copa América championship 1-0 over Colombia, snatching victory with an extra-time goal in the 112th minute of a scoreless match.
Lautaro Martínez blasted a shot past Colombia goalie Camilo Vargas on a breakaway following a turnover in the 112th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina, the defending champions of the tournament, as well as World Cup winners in 2022, were the favorites of the tournament and never trailed during the competition.
But it was forced to win the title without arguably the sport’s greatest player when Lionel Messi was subbed out in the 66th minute with an ankle injury.
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina won the 2024 Copa América championship 1-0 over Colombia, snatching victory with an extra-time goal in the 112th minute of a scoreless match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was marred by a delay of more than an hour after fans, many of whom didn’t have tickets, rushed the stadium and tried to get inside.
A handful of people could be seen receiving medical treatment and asking for water in the sweltering South Florida heat.
Others: Colombia’s 28-game international win streak was broken, which dated to February 2022, also a loss to Argentina.
